newsitem.title: ITALY: SOCCER-CROATIA'S BOKSIC TO SIGN FOR LAZIO, NEWSPAPERS SAY.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-CROATIA'S BOKSIC TO SIGN FOR LAZIO, NEWSPAPERS SAY.

text.p: Croatian striker Alen Boksic is expected to return to serie A side Lazio next season after only a year at league champions Juventus, Italian newspapers reported on Thursday.
Gazzetta dello Sport quoted Lazio owner Sergio Cragnotti as saying he had reached an agreement with Juventus for the 27-year-old striker, who played for the Rome club from 1993-96.
"With Juve there is a preliminary signature. With the player it is already worked out," Cragnotti said.

Boksic, who made his name by scoring 23 goals for French club Marseille in the 1992-93 season, had to fight for a regular place alongside Christian Vieri in the Juventus attack after getting injured late last year.
Gazzetta said Juventus wanted 24 billion lire ($14.1 million) from Lazio for the Croatian international who is under contract with the Turin side until 1999.
"If they accept our conditions we will happily let him go," Juventus general manager Luciano Moggi was quoted as saying.

Boksic would join experienced international Pierluigi Casiraghi and former Italy striker Roberto Mancini up front at Lazio. The 32-year-old Mancini signed a three-year contract with Lazio on Monday after 15 seasons at Sampdoria.
Cragnotti denied speculation that there would be no room in the new attacking line-up for Beppe Signori, who was serie A joint top goalscorer last season.
"We are not selling anybody. With Boksic, Casiraghi, Mancini, Signori, we have a great attack," he said.
